column8: text

PETALING JAYA: A talk will be organised to give an insight into the MCA and its contributions through the ages.Scheduled for 1pm on Saturday at Wisma MCA in Kuala Lumpur, the 150-minute talk is aimed at researchers, think tanks and anyone keen to know more about the party.To register, call 03-2203 3995/3954 or send a WhatsApp message with your full name, MyKad number, date of birth, home address, e-mail address, mobile number and profession to Johnny Yuen at 012-311 0880.The Malaysian Chinese Association: 1949 to Present will be delivered by Asst Prof Dr Heng Pek Koon, director of Asean Studies Initiative at American University in the United States.She will speak on MCA’s role in getting Malaysian Chinese citizenship in the country, safeguarding the Chinese community’s welfare during the Communist insurgency and protecting mother tongue education.Other areas to be covered include how the party is working to ensure the rights of all Malaysians as enshrined in the Federal Constitution, as well as the part it plays as a valuable partner in Barisan Nasional and the Government.Dr Heng will also outline the history of MCA, from its formation to the hurdles faced by its early leaders and its evolution since 1949.This will include an analysis of the changes in leadership and future political challenges confronting the party.
And you will suddenly become MCA member and BN voter next GE automatically. Your attendance and signature is not required.
